title.narrative: 8. Mine Action and Cluster Munitions Programme 2016 -2020

description.narrative: HALO is funded to deliver a 48-month project in Kosovo with a total cost of $763,208 to clear minefields and NATO cluster munition strikes. $381,604 is being provided by the Dutch Government to conduct landmine and cluster munitions clearance. This will be matched by a private donor committed to providing matched funding to HALO for the clearance of all remaining minefields in the country.
It is proposed that the project will release the following land: - 3 NATO cluster munition strikes covering 160,000m², and 10 minefields covering 262,000m²

To achieve the outputs, the total project, including match funding, will employ 14 Kosovan national staff divided into two seven-person demining teams. Over four years, it is estimated that the project will support 191 direct and 3,323 indirect beneficiaries.

Many of the minefields left to clear are located on agricultural land and woodland in rural, remote areas of Kosovo. Landmines were laid extensively during the war in Kosovo in the late 1990s by former Yugoslav forces, which resulted in substantial contamination and thereby restricted access to agricultural land and woodlands.Towards the end of the Kosovo War, NATO bombed Yugoslav targets over a period of 78 days in 1999; hundreds of thousands of sub-munitions were dropped from cluster bombs during this campaign. Both American-made BLU-97s and British-made BLU-755s were dropped throughout Kosovo. An estimated 20% of all cluster munitions dropped failed to activate, leaving rural areas in the country littered with unexploded sub-munitions.

activity-description.narrative: The HALO team is conducting manual mine clearance with metal detectors as well as full manual excavation. In addition to mine clearance the teams will conduct sub-surface battle area clearance for cluster munitions.

sector.narrative: The RNG funded teams will be conducting a variety of clearance techniques to ensure maximum efficency. For the Battle area clearance of cluster munitions, HALO will use sub-surface clearance techniques combining the use of Large Loop metal detectors (LLDs) in open areas such as agricultural fields and Schoenstedt magnetic locators where the LLD can not work effectovely such as dense forest. When conducting clearance of minefields the teams will use the latest clearance techniques and technologies such as linear clearance with dual sesnor detectors (in Kosovo HALO uses HSTAMIDS).

title.narrative: Analytical Report: HALO Annual Report 2016-17 Kosovo
Security and stability is enhanced, risk of death and injury to individuals and communities reduced

description.narrative: This outcome corresponds to the Netherlands' Government Strategic Rule of Law Policy Goal 1: 'Personal Safety'.

title.narrative: Percentage of direct beneficiaries surveyed reporting feeling safer following land release and RE activities

comment.narrative: This percentage was confirmed from a limited dataset. Reports in future quarters will have representative figures once all beneficiaries from the initial survey are interviewed.
Will be reported on after survey is completed in early 2019

description.narrative: Number of people in households who use the pathways, roads or bridges as the primary access route to residential, grazing or farming land, services, water sources or other infrastructure. And/Or number of people who regularly transit through the cleared/reduced areas to access other land.

description.narrative: Number of adult males (using local assessment of child/adult definition) in families which either own the cleared/reduced land, or who would benefit from frequent and long term use of the land.

comment.narrative: Ammended beneficiary numbers. The Dutch Match team were deployed to a new minefiled for five days in a before cleared village, which is why only direct beneficiaries are reported.
Only one task was opened this quarter. The second task was a continuation of a suspended task over the winter months/stand-down.

Q2 2020: Beneficiary numbers for Q1 2020 are ammended for Peja per above mentioned guideline. The form needs to be conducted for the task at Korbliq as well as soon as clearance re-commences at this task.
The number of direct beneficiaries are lower than Q1 and Q2 due to the fact that beneficiaries of tasks worked on this quarter were reported in previous quarters.
The number of direct beneficiaries are lower than Q1 and Q2 due to the fact that beneficiaries of tasks worked on this quarter were reported in previous quarters.

All beneficiary numbers have been updated for 2018 following the completion of the baseline survey through which HALO Kosovo has gathered more accurate beneficiary data. 2018 targets for beneficiary numbers were not reached due to geographical factors of cleared land less amenable to high beneficiary numbers. However, HALO has already surpassed the total contract target of beneficiaries due to prioritisation of land clearance in 2017, which yielded higher beneficiary numbers

Beneficiary numbers are determined by task selection. Task selection was agreed after the submission of the 2019 annual plan. The beneficiary targets listed here were determined in 2020 with KMAC once tasks were selected.

As reported last quarter, the programme has revised the method it uses to calculate direct and indirect beneficiaries, resulting in higher direct beneficiaries number in general. However the particular BAC task which received clearance in 2020 by HALO is a public park in the centre of Peja city with thousands of direct beneficiaries. This task was not in HALO's original work plan for this project. However, due to Covid, the programme was restricted as to where teams could operate and the team directed clearance at this task because it remained accessible during this time.

description.narrative: The area in square metres cleared through removal and/or destruction of all buried ERW hazards.

comment.narrative: Due to the Covid-19 pandemic HALO lost 2.5 out of the available 6 productive months as a result of national lock-down measures. This prevented the programme from reaching its annual target. However, the programme still managed to reach its overall BAC target for the project.
An item was found in close proximity to the initial suspected area and was cleared by HALO team at the request of KMAC. This resulted in more m2 cleared than initially anticipated
No annual plan submitted for this performance period. Targets equal outputs.

description.narrative: The area in square metres cleared through the removal and/or destruction of all specified mine and ERW hazards to a pre-determined depth, using manual or mechanical assets.

comment.narrative: Clearance commenced on March 5th after a period of stand-down for all operations teams
This quarter's clearance rate was back on track following the winter stand down
Winter stand-down (clearance recommenced in March) reduced the number of team months that could be completed this quarter.

Due to the Covid-19 pandemic HALO lost 2.5 out of the available 6 productive months as a result of national lock-down measures. This prevented the programme from reaching its annual target. However, the programme still managed to reach its overall mine clearance target for the project.
target overall

description.narrative: The area in square metres of Hazardous Area which has been reduced using Technical Survey methods.
The number of BAC tasks where clearance has been completed through removal and/or destruction of all ERW hazards.

The number of anti-personnel mines located and destroyed/rendered-safe during clearance/technical survey operations
The number of anti-vehicle mines located and destroyed/rendered-safe during clearance/technical survey operations
The number of completed minefields where clearance or technical survey has been conducted

comment.narrative: Due to the Covid-19 pandemic HALO lost 2.5 out of the available 6 productive months as a result of national lock-down measures. This prevented the programme from reaching its annual target. The programme did achieve the number of minefield tasks completed for the project overall.
Only areas fully cleared are reported cleared. Work is currently ongoing on other minefields which will be reported upon completion in 2019
No annual plan submitted for this performance period. Targets equal outputs.

The annual plan did not comment on number of tasks cleared in 2019, stating that "Demining tasks in Kosovo are allocated by the KMAC". The target of 2 minefields was decided after the annual plan was released and with agreement with KMAC in early 2020.

description.narrative: The number of rounds of small arms ammunition located and destroyed
